螆字的基本解释

螆
cì
〔螆蛦（
y?）〕古书上说的一种像龟的动物，背壳分为十余枚，相互密接，与人的掌纹相似，被称为“螆蛦掌”。亦作“兹夷”。

螆字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cì］
［《廣韻》七吏切，去志，清。］
见“螆蛦”。

螆字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　螆； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1092第27
【唐韻】同蛓。

螆字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
螆字的起名意思

暂无。

Moth
Basic explanation of words
Moth
cì
〔螆蛦(
y?)] A tortoise-like animal is said in ancient books. The back shell is divided into more than ten pieces, which are closely connected to each other, and are similar to the palm prints of human beings. They are called "scarf palms". Also known as "Zyi".
Moth
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cì］
["Guangyun" seven officials cut, go to record, clear. ]
See "Shingu".
Moth
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　螆; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1092 Page 27
【Tang Yun】The same cricket.
